pullrequest.title: [A-3] Dockerfile and supporting scripts for building ign-gazebo

content.raw:
If this is meant for deployment, I would suggest removing all the dev dependencies like doxygen, and let all ign library dependencies be pulled by the debs. The idea is to remove duplication. If DART removes the boost dependency in the future, there's no risk we will keep installing boost with no need. Makes sense?

I think it's also useful to have docker-for-development though, in which case the ignition libraries would all be built from source and in that case we do need to pull their dependencies one by one. But even in that case, I imagine we would install DART from debs.
